variety.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of Variety magazine, a weekly American trade publication that has been a player in the entertainment world since its launch in the early 20th Century.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Variety is owned by Penske Media Corporation (PMC), a private American digital media company with headquarters in Los Angeles that operates entertainment publications and websites in America, Europe, Asia, Australia, Canada, and Mexico. The site’s revenue comes from advertising and subscriptions.

Content

The site’s “About Us” page states that Variety “is the most authoritative and trusted source of entertainment business news reaching an audience of affluent influencers” and aims to provide individuals in the entertainment industry with “expert film, TV, digital, music, and theater business analysis and insights.” Variety’s original written and video content covers film, television, music, entertainment industry awards, technology, theater, real estate, gaming, and politics.

Credibility

When sexual misconduct allegations against Harvey Weinstein by dozens of women in the entertainment industry received national attention in October 2017, the Huffington Post accused longtime Variety editor-in-chief Peter Bart of preventing Variety from publishing unfavorable stories about Weinstein during his tenure from 1989 to 2009. Bart denied these allegations, calling them “‘ridiculous.’” Variety’s current co-editors in chief said in a statement that “[w]ith new ownership and new editorial leadership for the past five years, our publication has been devoted to hard-charging, dogged reporting, and, we never shy away from tough stories.” Bart currently serves on PMC’s board of advisors and as editor at large of Deadline, PMC’s entertainment breaking news website.

Variety publishes corrections in a note at the bottom of the article in question, as well as in a separate statement on the site.

Transparency

Bylines on the site include reporters’ names and Twitter handles. Articles written by guest columnists are accompanied by short biographical profiles. The site does not include profiles of its staff members. Phone numbers for the editorial and news branches of Variety’s offices may be found on the site’s “Contact Us” page.

The site clearly labels all advertising.

History

Variety was founded in 1905 by Sime Silverman, an American entertainment journalist. It initially covered burlesque,Vaudeville, and the burgeoning New York City theater scene. As the magazine’s coverage shifted its focus to Hollywood, the magazine began to publish a daily edition in 1933, Daily Variety, which was a mainstay in the film industry until it ceased publication in 2013.

In 2016, Variety endorsed Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton for president, the first time in its history that the magazine published a presidential endorsement.
